column1: After working with the White House I’m pleased @HHSGov will send 50000 rapid #COVID19 tests to CO to support testing needs & replace testing sites impacted by ongoing wildfires. I’ll keep fighting for Coloradans to have resources to get through #COVID19. https://t.co/RcuJ00BONx

Great news for Colorado’s two federally recognized Tribes ➡️ the @FCC granted spectrum licenses for the Ute Mountain Ute and Southern Ute Indian Tribes. This will help the Tribes connect to essential services during and after #COVID19 and help close the digital divide in CO. https://t.co/ZrYbxydEzN

Exciting news ➡️ @SouthwestAir announced today it plans to start service at @COSAirport in 2021. Going forward I will keep up my efforts to bolster the aviation workforce as we continue to respond to the #COVID19 pandemic. https://t.co/22QNVhbcgk

For the second time this week cynical political games have kept the American people from receiving the support they need to get through the #COVID19 pandemic. Read my statement and learn more about the relief package blocked today by Senate Democrats. ➡ https://t.co/3cuDSy8rPy https://t.co/m64R75NMgL

Partisan obstruction blocked #COVID19 relief for small businesses in Colorado today showing that Senate Democrats are more comfortable with people in the unemployment insurance office instead of on their employer’s payroll. My full statement: https://t.co/DbGrWy99fF https://t.co/CAH949GEMC

#COVID19 has increased our state’s mental health needs and during this unprecedented challenge suicide prevention is more important than ever. This change to 9-8-8 will make it easier for Americans dealing with a crisis to access mental health support that could be life-saving.

Recent funding will expand broadband access in SW Colorado to more than 1600 Coloradans 90 farms and 50 businesses.   I'll keep fighting for greater access to broadband which many rely on for an education telecommuting and healthcare during #COVID19. https://t.co/bzVffow4ar

Today @SecretarySonny and I announced @USDA is awarding $6.3 million to expand broadband service in SW Colorado. #COVID19 has laid bare the digital divide in many of our rural communities and it’s more important than ever to keep Coloradans connected to reliable broadband.
Farmers and ranchers who have been impacted by #COVID19 still have time to apply for relief from @USDA through the #CFAP2 program. Learn more and apply here ⬇ https://t.co/BUBOTVZ2cD
I’m wishing a quick recovery for the President First Lady and everyone across our country who has experienced #COVID19.  We will get through this pandemic by working together and staying united.

This week on #OurGreatOutdoors – I speak with President of the @REI Foundation Marc Berejka about the importance of public lands during #COVID19 and how the Great American @OutdoorsAct will create outdoor recreation opportunities for future generations.  📺 Watch below ⬇️ https://t.co/QD0QzKBGgP

I championed the Great American @OutdoorsAct to improve access to and preserve our public lands that are entwined with our identity and way of life in Colorado.   It will also provide great economic and job opportunities for areas hit hardest by #COVID19. https://t.co/g4UCvHvwk8

Thank you @SenatorBaldwin @JerryMoran @SenJackReed @RepChrisStewart @TeamMoulton and everyone who got the message across that #988CantWait.  Our country is facing an unprecedented challenge in responding to #COVID19 and suicide prevention is now more important than ever.

This bill provides crucial support for CO researchers working around the clock during #COVID19.  @CUSystem President @CUMarkKennedy says the RISE Act "will ensure CU faculty and student researchers across all four campuses can continue critical projects and career development."

Today @SenateCommerce passed my bipartisan RISE Act to provide $26B to US researchers who have been impacted by #COVID19. This bill will help ensure the US is prepared to continue our global scientific leadership during and after this crisis. Learn more ➡️ https://t.co/tM43dLFNCt https://t.co/kjmc08HJlX

On average we lose a Coloradan to death by suicide every seven hours and providers across the nation are facing extraordinary increases in call volume due to #COVID19.   Every day the House delays is a missed opportunity to support suicide prevention and save lives.

Coloradans and the American people are in desperate need of relief. I’m calling on my colleagues on both sides of the aisle to pass this #COVID19 relief package without delay.   Watch my remarks on the US Senate floor ⬇ https://t.co/EkoAbc0SpS

📺 WATCH LIVE 📺   At approximately 6:45pm ET / 4:45pm MT I will be speaking on the US Senate floor regarding the #COVID19 relief package being considered by the Senate. Watch live here ➡️ https://t.co/cRFtEkDBaF

It will extend much-needed expanded unemployment benefits and provide billions of dollars for the postal service safe in-person learning #COVID19 testing vaccine development farm assistance small business relief and more.

The latest and 5th coronavirus relief package before the Senate isn’t the beginning or the end of our response to #COVID19. But it is an opportunity to support out-of-work Americans help small businesses and provide critical resources to stop the spread of #COVID19.
Read my statement on the latest #COVID19 relief package being considered by the US Senate. ⬇️ https://t.co/ZOz15S5hNb https://t.co/Ph3h7ndoqq

I held a roundtable in CO Springs on the impacts of #COVID19 and supporting the performing arts and live entertainment industry. I fought to ensure nonprofits are eligible for the #PaycheckProtectionProgram and support the #SaveOurStages Act and #RESTART Act to provide relief. https://t.co/TIG3jDxBFc

Thank you to @CajunChefBB in CO Springs for meeting with me and talking about the difficulties restaurants are facing from #COVID19. Restaurants are cornerstones of Colorado communities and I’m proud to cosponsor the RESTAURANTS Act to give restaurant owners and workers relief. https://t.co/4Ki9JIgHz0

.@HHSgov acted to make assisted living facilities eligible for support through the Provider Relief Fund at my request. I fought to get this done because this funding will help support the health and safety of assisted living residents during the #COVID19 pandemic. https://t.co/SDDPU3W9X6
Farmers and ranchers who have been impacted by #COVID19 still have time to apply for relief through @USDA’s Coronavirus Food Assistance Program. Learn more here ⬇️ https://t.co/vs9XYTypo3

#COVID19 caused extreme financial stress in communities across CO and now many are also battling wildfires. @SenatorBennet @RepTipton and I called on @USDA to approve the @CityofGWS’ request for assistance as they recover from the Grizzly Creek Fire. https://t.co/UhyF4P1O1s

CO will receive $20.8M to provide prevention treatment and recovery services for opioid use disorders and address the rising threat of methamphetamines. Reports show CO had a record number of overdose deaths in 2019. During #COVID19 these services are more important than ever. https://t.co/zLRnABmsrW

Good news ➡️ 19 Federally Qualified Health Centers in CO will receive a combined $2M from @HRSAgov to support healthcare services. FQHCs provide essential services to their communities and I'll keep fighting to support their ability to provide care during #COVID19 and beyond. https://t.co/D0MEHab4hv

At my urging the @USDA announced it will continue providing flexibility for school lunch programs through December 31st to ensure students in Colorado and across the nation have access to nutritious meals during #COVID19. Learn more ⬇️ https://t.co/n1vCWKpIRL

Communities across Colorado are hurting due to #COVID19 and we must keep working to ensure relief is reaching those in need. I fought for passage of the CARES Act and I’m proud it has brought $110.2M in @HUDgov grants to CO to address the ongoing pandemic. https://t.co/7Pug6mFuSF

I am grateful for the extraordinary work scientific researchers at @ColoradoStateU are doing to find solutions to #COVID19. I enjoyed our discussion yesterday and will keep fighting for R&D investments to support robust testing and the development of an effective safe vaccine. https://t.co/bFiCMyb33o

I enjoyed meeting with @YMCANOCO to discuss how we can support the safety of childcare services and how we can improve the #PaycheckProtectionProgram to ensure local nonprofits have the resources they need to get through #COVID19. https://t.co/8InZSicE04

Rural hospitals deliver critical healthcare services to rural communities and are more essential than ever during #COVID19. I’m excited to see nearly $2M to support improvements to Mt. San Rafael Hospital’s facility to better serve Coloradans in Trinidad and the surrounding area. https://t.co/PmMLKEZ5R5

Today @JerryMoran and I joined @mhinnovationCU to discuss mental health needs and our efforts with @SenatorBaldwin and @SenJackReed to establish the #988SuicideHotline. #COVID19 has upended life as we know it making access to mental health support even more important. https://t.co/CrluK5E98N

I’m grateful to see $300000 delivered to the Southern Ute Indian and Ute Mountain Ute Tribes to respond to #COVID19. We must continue fighting to ensure federally recognized tribes have the resources they need to get through this pandemic. https://t.co/BpLhpXqvsv

Just received confirmation that Colorado’s application for enhanced unemployment benefits was approved. This is great news and I’ll continue to work with @GovofCO and my colleagues to make sure out-of-work Coloradans are receiving relief to get through #COVID19.

#COVID19 has caused unprecedented challenges for small businesses and especially startup companies. Today I held a roundtable in Colorado Springs with local startups to hear firsthand how we can continue supporting local businesses and workers through this pandemic. https://t.co/8Gc3zGhS6U

I enjoyed visiting MarillacHealth in Grand Junction to celebrate National Health Center Week and learn about their partnerships with @CentralHighGJ @CommunityHosp & @HBofGV. I'll keep fighting to ensure CHCs have support to continue providing care both during #COVID19 & beyond. https://t.co/hnOtBPzqJN

The @OutdoorsAct is a historic conservation win for Colorado and our nation and in times of crisis caused by #COVID19 it also provides economic opportunities for Colorado communities hit hard by the pandemic.   Read my op-ed in the @DailySentinelGJ: https://t.co/g4UCvHvwk8

I’m proud to introduce the American Dream Down Payment Act with @SenDougJones to make it easier for people to save for a down payment on a house which will aid both our unique housing challenges in Colorado and our economic recovery from #COVID19. https://t.co/cUnhHIrHrv https://t.co/xpTLyrnqz6

Coloradans and Americans everywhere have benefitted from expanded telehealth services during #COVID19. I’m pleased to see the Administration’s commitment to maintaining these services and I'll keep fighting for legislation to make telehealth more accessible. https://t.co/sMZfqZ1vim

TODAY ➡️ @realDonaldTrump will sign my bipartisan Great American @OutdoorsAct into law. This is the single greatest conservation achievement for Colorado in generations one that will benefit every county and our recovery from the #COVID19 pandemic. https://t.co/R65caeURpl

I’m excited to see @NIH invest more than $248 million in #COVID19 testing technology. In order to fully beat this pandemic we must be able to see where the illness is and where it is not and this funding will help expand our testing capabilities. https://t.co/dviQyTIDQ6

In April the entire Colorado congressional delegation secured funding to support @CONG1860’s efforts to combat #COVID19 through August 21. As we continue our efforts to stop the spread we’re working together to extend funding through the end of the year. https://t.co/QQklpjFDKT

In light of the unprecedented challenge from #COVID19 access to suicide prevention services is more important than ever. The US Senate passed S. 2661 to establish the #988SuicideHotline. @SenatorBaldwin and I are calling on the US House to pass it now: https://t.co/D6xYPbR2XU https://t.co/CzbM3WcB8O

Glad to see the announcement from @Hopeonwheels and @Hyundai that they will be awarding $500000 in grants to @ChildrensColo to expand their drive-thru #COVID19 testing site capacity and support pediatric cancer research in Colorado.

I enjoyed hosting a roundtable at Bright Beginnings Learning Center with @IvankaTrump to discuss the vital role child care centers play in economic recovery. I’ll keep fighting for the resources necessary to support safe child care options during #COVID19. https://t.co/6pvVHbpjGk

Passage of the Great American @OutdoorsAct could not come at a more critical time. #COVID19 has created challenging times but inspiration and hope can always be found in our public lands and the #GreatOutdoors. This bill will benefit the entire country for generations. https://t.co/KDPMjZWy5M

I’m calling on @CISAGov and @FBI to bolster our national cybersecurity to protect against malicious attacks from Russia and the Chinese Communist Party. We must ensure US universities and labs have proper assistance as we pursue a #COVID19 vaccine. https://t.co/MXieZalwcB

#COVID19 has affected all of CO and we must keep working to stabilize our economy and ensure relief is reaching those in need. I fought for passage of the CARES Act and am glad to see @US_EDA award $400000 to Montrose to help bolster the local economy. https://t.co/7f7f1yjLdE

We must protect US universities laboratories and our international partners from malicious Chinese and Russian hackers as we pursue a #COVID19 vaccine. I’m calling on @CISAgov and @FBI to bolster our national cybersecurity infrastructure. https://t.co/hVe2ppWNso

Over $142M was awarded by @HHSgov to support our healthcare workers on the front lines of #COVID19 at 27 hospitals in CO. Doctors nurses and other healthcare professionals are working tirelessly to keep us safe and I'll keep fighting to ensure they have resources they need. https://t.co/v8OscP1PSU

In response to recent reports detailing Russian and Chinese interference in #COVID19 vaccine research and development I'm calling on @CISAgov and @FBI to immediately bolster US national cybersecurity infrastructure and provide assistance to affected US entities. ⬇ https://t.co/Q2VemSuWW1

In order to beat #COVID19 we must be able to see where the illness is and is not. I’m pleased to see an additional grant of over $200000 to expand Colorado’s testing capacity and I will keep fighting to ensure Colorado has the resources necessary to combat this virus. https://t.co/dIxGqSmtYA

The @FCC will award more than $55000 to improve telehealth services in Pueblo which will help people access critical healthcare without leaving home during #COVID19 and into the future. I will keep fighting for healthcare access across all of Colorado. https://t.co/k17oL0lYyl

The #PaycheckProtectionProgram has helped small businesses across Colorado survive during #COVID19 and we must continue to ensure they receive the support they need. I introduced a bill to allow businesses to apply for a second PPP loan and extend the PPP deadline. https://t.co/Sb7heL2Cg6

I fought hard to ensure rural hospitals were eligible for #COVID19 relief through the #PaycheckProtectionProgram. Not only do they deliver critical healthcare services they are also the largest employer in many communities. https://t.co/ketebGRV1W

.@TECRO_USA I wish a warm farewell to my friend Ambassador Stanley Kao who has played a tremendous role in furthering the US-Taiwan partnership. I'm particularly grateful for his role in delivering medical supplies from #Taiwan to Colorado in our joint battle against #COVID19.

Through the CARES Act the @FCC has awarded nearly $4M to expand telehealth services in Colorado to allow more Coloradans to access healthcare from their homes during #COVID19. This is great news for Colorado and I’ll keep fighting to expand Colorado’s telehealth opportunities. https://t.co/GXEgVTnJlA
The TEST Act which I introduced with @SenatorBennet would create a better public health testing system to help solve the #COVID19 crisis and help prevent future pandemics. https://t.co/s0hZdT7MG1

In order to fully beat #COVID19 it’s important to rapidly see where the illness is and is not. My bipartisan TEST Act provides key components of detecting and preventing outbreaks to help contain this virus and respond to outbreaks in the future. https://t.co/Z4HPvxYhGz

Many children’s hospitals are struggling as a result of #COVID19 and @HHSGov must provide additional funding to support these hospitals to ensure children are receiving the best possible care. https://t.co/hKIi76V6TM

Coloradans expect their elected leaders to work together to deliver responsible solutions and as our nation continues to battle #COVID19 we must continue working together so that we can get through to the other side stronger than ever.

.@SenatorBennet @SenatorRomney @SenatorSinema and I introduced the TEST Act which we developed with @ScottGottliebMD to improve our ability to contain #COVID19 and respond to future outbreaks. This will give businesses and the American people the confidence to reopen safely.

Today’s #JobsReport shows that programs like the #PaycheckProtectionProgram are working but we must continue to provide relief to small businesses facing uncertainty while we simultaneously work to combat and contain #COVID19. https://t.co/O5c7IuMywC

As our nation continues to battle #COVID19 the PPP will be an essential tool to keep our economy as stable as possible which is why I supported Senate passage of legislation to extend the application deadline through August 8. https://t.co/Bf8qhGDZby

Last month the Senate passed and @realDonaldTrump signed into law a version of my PPP Flexibility Act which extended the #PaycheckProtectionProgram loan period and provided greater flexibility to small businesses needing relief through #COVID19.

With #COVID19 upending life as we know it suicide prevention is critically important. This week every @FCC commissioner endorsed my #988SuicideHotline bill with @SenatorBaldwin @teammoulton and @RepChrisStewart and agreed the House should swiftly pass it. https://t.co/T8fsMXSOZI

Scammers continue to use the uncertainty of #COVID19 to take advantage of others. My CEASE Act with @SenCapito and @SenatorSinema would increase punishments for scammers making it clear their actions will not be tolerated.   Learn more about how to avoid scams from @IRSNews ⬇ https://t.co/psuQ93l53Y
A reminder for small businesses in Colorado ➡️ The deadline to apply for the #PaycheckProtectionProgram to receive assistance through #COVID19 is this Tuesday June 30. https://t.co/q0AubrMG88

Read my op-ed with Fort Collins Mayor @WadeTroxell in the @coloradoan on why the bipartisan Great American @OutdoorsAct is a historic chance for conservation and also an opportunity to help Colorado recover from #COVID19. https://t.co/N49bUUHTxP

Thanks to @USDA @SecretarySonny for meeting with Coloradans and for our productive discussions about supporting our farmers protecting our state’s great outdoors and helping Coloradans through #COVID19. https://t.co/IVBOX0s5DM

The Farmers to Families Food Box Program is a win-win – it helps farmers during #COVID19 and provides food to people in need. @SecretarySonny and I discussed the program’s success in Colorado with @FoodBankRockies. https://t.co/7VeqKgsTkl

Telehealth has helped Coloradans across all four corners of our state access healthcare during #COVID19 and I’m calling on Congress to make these services available permanently to all Medicare beneficiaries. https://t.co/wR07T7yECi

Farmers and ranchers have been working around the clock to ensure our food supply chain is not disrupted during #COVID19 and have been hit particularly hard. Proud to hold a roundtable with @SecretarySonny and the @ColoFarmBureau in Keenesburg to discuss how we will move forward. https://t.co/hOLDQlhRNV

Small businesses have been hit particularly hard by #COVID19 and @SBAGov has resources to help including information to assist with the #PaycheckProtectionProgram application. Learn more here ⬇️ https://t.co/RMwo6ucyqv

Our mountain communities have been hit hard economically by #COVID19. My bipartisan Great American Outdoors Act will provide funding to #RestoreOurParks and create more than 100000 jobs nationwide. https://t.co/kz0VEogkPr

We have been trying for decades to fully #FundLWCF and #RestoreOurParks. With the Great American Outdoors Act we have a historic window to achieve it while also providing shovel-ready jobs to communities hit hard by #COVID19. https://t.co/caUmwUhJSP

Prior to the pandemic we were living in one of the greatest economies the world has ever seen but #COVID19 has decimated towns across the country. My #GreatOutdoors Act will provide shovel-ready jobs to protect our public lands & help boost our economy. https://t.co/ZS5LHRTRBk

Scammers continue to take advantage of people during #COVID19. My CEASE Act with @SenatorSinema and @SenCapito makes it clear these criminal acts will not be tolerated and increases punishments.   Learn more from the @FTC about how you can avoid coronavirus scams and fraud. ⬇ https://t.co/7f8w8BwV4Q

The #PaycheckProtectionProgram Flexibility Act will triple the loan period for #PPP loans and provide greater flexibility to small businesses and workers in CO and across the US. I’m proud to have ushered this bill across the finish line to help workers get through #COVID19. https://t.co/3mQGWYaYSx

Thank you to everyone who participated in the “Rocky Mountain Recovery” #COVID19 town hall hosted by @KDVR. If you missed it you can watch here for the latest Coloradans should know about #COVID19. ⬇ https://t.co/4GTbXX6zmE

Today I announced Colorado will receive $44 million to address homelessness and the coronavirus pandemic. #COVID19 has affected our entire country and we must ensure relief is reaching everyone in need. https://t.co/tG8vEmW0D2

We have got to reopen our economy. I’m working on a concept that we’re putting forward called Rehire America that will help pay salaries for employees help address fixed costs for businesses to get this country going. More from my live #COVID19 town hall with @KDVR ⬇️ https://t.co/UFaZg0Ei1k
TONIGHT at 7pm MT ➡️ I’m joining state local and federal officials from Colorado for a live #COVID19 town hall hosted by @KDVR. Learn more and tune in here ⬇️ https://t.co/EJcf1w3S4J

The PPP has already provided more than 98000 loans in Colorado and these modifications will increase flexibility to help small businesses that are struggling as a result of #COVID19 to keep their doors open and their workers on payroll.

Yesterday the Senate passed a version of my PPP Flexibility Act to extend the #PaycheckProtectionProgram loan period & provide greater flexibility. We must keep improving this program to ensure workers & small business owners can make it through #COVID19. https://t.co/bNnIxfSn9k

NEW ➡️ 6 bipartisan former @Interior secretaries are urging passage of my #GreatOutdoors Act. This bill will permanently #FundLWCF and #RestoreOurParks by addressing National Parks maintenance backlog providing job opportunities for areas that have been hit hardest by #COVID19. https://t.co/r2QH84ybqO

The #PaycheckProtectionProgram is an essential lifeline for small businesses in Colorado during #COVID19 and I’m fighting to make it more flexible and better support small businesses and workers. Learn more about the Paycheck Protection Program from @SBAgov. ⬇️ https://t.co/oM66mPl0A6

Yesterday at the Montrose Public Lands Center we discussed my bipartisan Great American Outdoors Act and how it will protect the lands we cherish while also providing economic opportunities and jobs that will help our communities recover from #COVID19. https://t.co/QesOOaT8e4

Personal protective equipment is crucial for those on the front lines combatting #COVID19. I’m grateful for the hard work of the team at the @FEMA Battelle site in Montrose who are disinfecting N95 masks for reuse across Colorado. https://t.co/r8MznjJyW7
Farmers and ranchers who have been impacted by #COVID19 can now apply for @USDA’s Coronavirus Food Assistance Program to receive relief. Learn more here ⬇ https://t.co/VC7JVWnLm5

Live music venues were among the first to close because of #COVID19 and will likely be among the last to reopen – it’s critical that we provide support for these venues which are central to the social cultural and economic fabric of our communities. https://t.co/Nsx1b87asT

Residents of nursing homes & long-term care facilities are particularly vulnerable to #COVID19. I’m glad to see @HHSgov announce $51.8M from the CARES Act for skilled nursing facilities in CO to respond to #COVID19 & I'll keep fighting to protect seniors. https://t.co/iC96VqD3S6

National Guard servicemembers have provided invaluable support on the front lines during #COVID19. @SenatorBennet @RepJasonCrow @RepDLamborn and I led a bipartisan fight to ensure they’re taken care of during and after this crisis. https://t.co/Og9fnE3Umw

EMS professionals always work day and night to provide emergency critical care and now they are on the front lines in the fight against #COVID19. During #NationalEMSWeek we recognize their hard work and selfless dedication. https://t.co/TRrAfR5ef5

.@SenateCommerce passed my bipartisan bill to advance our bioeconomy and new scientific developments like improved vaccines and innovations in agriculture food medicine clothing and more. This will be crucial as we rush to develop a #COVID19 vaccine. https://t.co/9BYOhDAr1C

I’m grateful to our friends in Taiwan and for their gracious donation of 10000 N95 masks to Colorado. Taiwan has played an invaluable role in helping the global community respond to #COVID19. #TaiwanCanHelp https://t.co/5Ua6qpmJuA

The Chinese Communist Party is using #COVID19 a disease they hid and helped spread globally to force #HongKong to its knees and break Beijing’s promise to uphold Hong Kong’s autonomy. https://t.co/KoP0L7ATrQ

I've also secured Senate action in June on my bipartisan Great American Outdoors Act to create immediate job opportunities and enhance our public lands. Mountain towns have been hit hard by #COVID19 and this will provide billions for new jobs across CO. https://t.co/gujT00eDDU

59 Rural Health Clinics in CO are receiving nearly $3M to expand #COVID19 testing in rural areas. These clinics play a critical role in our rural communities and are on the front lines of the fight against #COVID19. I'll keep working to ensure they have the resources they need. https://t.co/Pk8rqeUy9F

State and local governments and tribes are facing unanticipated revenue shortfalls on top of unprecedented expenses because of #COVID19. @SenatorBennet @RepJoeNeguse @RepJasonCrow and I are calling on @FEMA to reimburse 100% of the approved #COVID19 related costs. Our letter ⬇ https://t.co/QFjqZUnY1T
It’s our job to help get the country back to work and make it through #COVID19. Now is not the time for the Senate to go home.

We must improve our response to the health crisis. Nursing homes and long-term care facilities need greater support. Over 50% of Colorado's #COVID19 deaths have been at these facilities. We must set aside billions more in direct funding tests and PPE. https://t.co/6uwr3dN0XK

It’s unfathomable that the Senate is set to go on recess without considering any additional #COVID19 assistance for the American people. Anyone who thinks now is the time to go on recess hasn’t been listening. Coloradans and Americans alike have sacrificed and are hurting.
Taiwan's invaluable role in combatting #COVID19 including the donation of medical equipment to Colorado has been a testament of their global leadership and determination.

This commonsense bill will provide the CARES Act's $500 direct payments to parents with children born in 2020 now instead of in 2021. The CARES Act took bold steps to help Americans through #COVID19. We must continue to improve it to ensure relief is reaching those in need.

#COVID19 has caused immediate financial hardships for families in Colorado and across the United States. People need relief now not in a year's time. This is especially true for new parents and why I'm joining the bipartisan Newborn CARES Act.

We need to work with every global partner committed to transparency to beat #COVID19 and Taiwan has been at the forefront of the global response. The US stands with Taiwan – as made clear by my TAIPEI Act. #TaiwanCanHelp https://t.co/P7cEtZCK4i

Seniors are at higher risk for #COVID19 and more must done to keep them safe – that’s why I’m fighting for more support for nursing homes and senior care centers including more personal protective equipment for seniors and workers. https://t.co/To7qekwxbr

It was great to join @KDVR live this morning for an update on our approach to get our country through #COVID19. We need to continue to come together in a bipartisan fashion to get people the assistance they need and our country back on its feet. https://t.co/dB8WVkBGCM

Thank you to everyone who participated in my #COVID19 telephone town hall last night with @GovofCO. If you missed it you can listen here for the latest about what Coloradans should know about the pandemic and how our state is planning to move forward. ⬇ https://t.co/aNuVgjuZPK

.@WHNSC created a taskforce at my request in order to counter CCP’s disinformation campaign about #COVID19. It needs to produce a report to Congress as soon as possible with detailed findings and a plan of action.
It is urgent that we hold China accountable. Instead of working responsibly with the world on the coronavirus the CCP is choosing to interfere in U.S. elections. https://t.co/dj0wAAcbqC

I’ve had conversations this week with @NIH and @WHNSC about #COVID19 – it’s clear that China still refuses to cooperate refuses transparency and refuses communication with the rest of the world. This is reckless and irresponsible.
We must ensure long-term care facilities are receiving the appropriate support to combat #COVID19 and protect their residents who are at a particularly high risk of contracting the virus.
Just got out of a meeting with @POTUS and @GovofCO – thank you @realDonaldTrump for committing to send 190000 #COVID19 testing kits to Colorado.

#NationalPoliceWeek is a time for our nation to recognize the valiant service of police officers in every community and the sacrifices they make day in and day out – particularly now in the midst of the #COVID19 pandemic. Thank you and God bless you forever have my support. https://t.co/UnFMjHtY4G

At our request $10B was set aside for rural healthcare providers with $188M flowing to Colorado. We also secured clarification from @SBA that Critical Access Hospitals & Rural Health Clinics are eligible for the #PaycheckProtectionProgram helping them stay open during #COVID19.

I had a productive meeting at the White House today with @POTUS and reiterated the need for additional state and local funding to get through #COVID19 as @GovofCO @SenatorBennet and I requested last month. https://t.co/5AyXYVOy24

In order to defeat #COVID19 we must cooperate with every global partner committed to transparency and best practices – including Taiwan which has stepped up as a leader during this pandemic. Taiwan’s exclusion from the @WHO is inexcusable.
Today the Senate unanimously passed legislation I’m backing to support Taiwan’s participation in the @WHO. This would allow Taiwan to share its expertise in handling #COVID19 with the world.
